html:
ROME, Jan 20 (Reuters) - Italy's antitrust regulator said on Thursday it had recalculated the fines for U.S tech giants Apple AAPL.O and Amazon AMZN.O due to a "material error" in the first calculation.

The fines now amounted to 114.7 million euros ($130.04 million) for Apple and 58.6 million euros for Amazon, down from 134.5 million euros and 68.7 respectively, the watchdog said in a statement.

The authority had said in November it had fined the two groups for allegedly engaging in anti-competitive cooperation in the sale of Apple and Beats products. (Full Story)



($1 = 0.8821 euros)


(Reporting by Giulia Segreti,e diting by Gianluca Semeraro)

(( Giulia.Segreti@tr.com ; +39.06. 80307714; ))

Keywords: ITALY-ANTITRUST/AMAZON-APPLE (URGENT)
